eligibilityCriteria.criteria: Films produced within the last 12 months, not shown on the internet or released on DVD.
Films under 15 minutes and produced in the last 12 months, not shown on the internet.
Directed by a student, made in the last 18 months, not presented at major international festivals.
Films promoting cinematographic heritage works, newly restored copies or documentaries about cinema.

fees.feeDetails: 50 euros for DVD/Blu-ray, 300 euros for DCP, 60 Euros for online submission

festivalInfo.description: The Cannes Film Festival, held annually in the French Riviera, continues to be one of the most prestigious and glamorous events in the film industry. Carried by its 77 editions, the international Festival de Cannes is one of the world's most widely publicized events and certainly the most important film festival in terms of worldwide impact The festival showcases the best in global cinema, drawing filmmakers, actors, and cinephiles from around the world. With its iconic red carpet, screenings of cutting-edge films, and a coveted Palme d'Or awarded to the top film, Cannes is a platform where both established and emerging talents shine. Today, it remains a symbol of excellence and a launchpad for cinematic innovation
festivalInfo.name: Cannes Film Festival

cannesClassics.criteria: Films promoting cinematographic heritage, newly restored films, or documentaries about cinema.

featureFilm.conditions: Films produced during the 12 months preceding the Festival...

laCinef.conditions: Film must be directed by a student and not exceed 60 min in running-time.

shortFilm.conditions: Films produced in the last 12 months and not presented at international festivals.
